info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Cumberland and northeastern Prince Edward Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Centenary to near Gold Hill to Cartersville. Movement was south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Cumberland, Farmville, Cartersville, Longwood University, Guinea Mills, Sunnyside, Lakeside Village, Raines Tavern, Trents Mill, Angola, Ashby, Oak Forest, McRae, Clinton, Hawk, Reeds, Whiteville, Grays Siding, Bear Creek Lake State Park and Stoddert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
